I was subscribed to Pet Treater for almost a year and I never had any issues until we moved and one of my orders did not get delivered. I reached out and after corresponding with this company, it is clear they only want you money and to not provide you with the best product. They refunded me 75% of my order that I did not receive after FIGHTING with them. This refund is not suffice and I made them aware and still nothing was done. I have filed a claim with my bank and the BBB. The price is great but customer service sucks and  to this day my dog tore through every toy they received within 24 hours. Quality is awful.

I decided to try Pet Treater for our kitten because at $15 a month, it was less expensive than most pet subscription boxes. Plus I found a coupon code for 50% the first bag. We have received 2 months of bags so far. And have been pleased with everything in the bags. There’s always something different I would have never thought to purchase. Our kitten loves most of the toys and all of the treats. Our entire family gets excited when our Pet Treater bag arrives

Pet treater is a great way to treat my two cats! They know the box when it comes in the mail and can’t wait to open it to all kind of goodies

Zooey is a big fan of Pet Treater! She loves getting new cat toys & treats each month! And they’re seriously her favorite toys. It’s fun and convenient to have a new cat pack shipped to the house each month. We both looked forward to mail day! :)

My pom Newman loves his Pet Treater subscription. We look forward to it each month. His favorite treats are now ones we got from Pet Treater and he LOOVED the toy received this month. He goes nuts to play with it.

My dog has absolutely loved pet treater and so have I! I love having something my dog looks forward to getting every month, every month my boxes are unique and filled with different things. Anytime I have a question or concern pet treater contacts me back very quickly.

I placed my initial order with Pet Treater on August 7.  One August 9, my account showed that Newgistics had picked up my order to deliver to USPS. One week after placing my order (August 14), it still showed that my order still had not been delivered to USPS.  I contacted them and was told that my order was shipped out on August 13.  They told me that it takes 48 hours for tracking to show any movement. As of August 15, my order still has not been received by USPS. I canceled my subscription.  It's sad because I was really looking forward to this. I may never receive this, but that most definitely have my money.

I have had a subscription to pettreater for over a year now I believe. Bandanas were not in the box when I first started and it kinda sucks that the cheap piece of fabric that unravels counts as 1 item. You usually get a themed box but sometimes you don’t. You always get a cookie with icing. This month I was sent 2 to make up for another item they didn’t want to give me I guess. I have received 2 packages now full of ants and I will be canceling because of this. The first time I had to throw everything out except the toys. They went into the wash before use. The company sent me a new box but sent it to the wrong address (my old one) which is my moms house and 30 minutes away which is very frustrating. This second time I have another box with ants. I check my mailbox and no ants in there. I’ve ordered medicine and no ants got into it. The box has a sealed bag around it so it must’ve been packaged with ants. I believe the cookie is the cause of the ants. Whether the cookies come straight from the company or sit in warehouse to be packed I don’t know. Overall this is a fair box. Some months you get poor items or things you might not use. I got a water purifier for camping? I’ve gotten sample sized treats as well. The most recent treats I gave my dogs caused 3 to get diarrhea. That was the only thing they had different that day so I would say it was the treats so they go to the bin. The toys usually 2 a month, are decent quality. The newest box one was destroyed in 10 minutes. The other will last a while. Usually you get a stuffed toy and a harder toy. You get 2 treat bags. A cookie and a bandana. Sometimes you get different items like a coozie or spray for your dog like deodorizer. I would overall recommend this company but after 2 ant infested boxes I would say buyer beware.

My niece/dog is always SO excited for her box to arrive. She knows it’s for her and it makes me feel reassured  that she’s getting such quality products and treats. I love being an dog auntie and the subscription box is such an easy gift. Customer service has been so great with all my questions. Really love this company beyond the other options.

Enjoyed by my dog and great that it's grain free and well presented in the sleeves. Would be great if a smaller portion size was available.

best food for my cats i've found,lovely small kibble,cats love it,my only moan i wish you could buy a bigger bag feeding 3 cats it is a bit expensive buying 750 grms at a time .

Gizmo was never hard to train, however since changing his food to scrumbles that contains DHA (docosahexaenoic acid) he seems more alert and focused. As Gizmo is out and about often, he not only eats and enjoys the scumbles dog food but they have a variety of snacks and training treats that are so good for him. I have had my 2 dogs on their 100% plan for a few months now. At first I really liked it and the dogs seemed to be as well. And when I called the representative only gave me the reason/excuse that they don't operate in a mass produced factory so that happens. That's it. Like starving my dog is okay. And when I say starving, I'm not exaggerating. My totally healthy dog has lost over 5 lbs in the past 1-2 months. And she's become food aggressive with my other dog. Once I started weighing the packages recently, it all made sense. I gave the company a chance to make up and correct it, but they only wanted to offer an excuse and wouldn't even let me speak to someone else. They're untrustworthy and have no problem starving animals to make more of a profit.

Not like it no matter what I did to the food like warm it up as suggested by a costumer service rep I gave all 5 little trays always to friend dog who seem to like it warm my dog didn’t like it at all and I would not buy again also I never did get my $ back as said on and about satisfaction guaranteed oh well If u have a picky dog don’t buy it it’s a mushy conciatancy looks like baby poop I didn’t like that either

The consistency of the food isn’t very appealing to my dog. He has a harder time eating it when it’s gooey and watery. The amount delivered takes up my entire freezer. I would personally prefer to get 2 week deliveries so I save freezer space.

On the one hand, the dog adores this food, so that's a plus. As far as the experience of Ollie, it has been mixed. One of my major issues has been the lack of consistency in the food itself. Sometimes a whole batch is sticky and gooey and sometimes it's like a more solid brick that crumbles easily. As far as the whole redesign, I do not like getting as much food as I do. It seems a little out of touch to expect people to be able to fit all that food in their freezer at one time--and it's A LOT of food at once. The individual food packages are so small, we have to really stay on top of things to make sure we are taking more out of the freezer with enough time to thaw. The plastic container they sent ostensibly to store the thawed food holds two of the tiny food packages, but it seems pointless to open up a food package and empty the food into the container just to scoop it all right back out at the next feeding. The one nice new thing is the food scooper. It cuts through the food beautifully and makes serving the food much easier than the awkward scoop they had before.
So far, so good!  My little dog Riley cleans his bowl!
Dogs love it!

Our dog, Dooley Dawg is loving the new packaging and food.  He eats the food without adding other products to it.  He is very finicky when it comes to his meals.  He lays and waits in the kitchen for his meals now instead of me coaxing him to eat.  The new packaging is a great plus.  I have actually taken the food out of the package and put it in a microwave safe plate and defrosted the food and then warmed it a little and fed it to Dooley.  Dooley prefers his meal warmed up for a minute 15 secs in the microwave.  He is a little spoiled.
I love the product - but the new packaging is a huge pain.  I'd prefer it was either packaged for an individual meal or packaged for more than 1 day.

I went in to my order figuring that it would not get filled, based on how basic the website looked and a few of the online reviews. Most of the reviews were pretty good though, so I tried it out. I ordered two boxes of Revolution for cats, as it was 50$ cheaper than what I would pay in the US...and that price included shipping. I chose the shipping without tracking as the other option was quite a bit more. My order came in exactly two weeks later. I had emailed 13 days in to customer service and I got a reply about 10 hours later, I imagine due to the time difference. They said if I didn't receive my order soon, they would replace it or give me a refund. I didn't need to either of those thankfully. The medication was in metric packaging [Stronghold]. I would recommend ordering from them if you'd like to save money and don't mind having the medication in metric units [the worldwide standard, anyway].

I've ordered meds for my pets for 7 years from this service without issue; never had my credit info compromised.  I place my orders when I use the last dosage, affording a month for the next delivery, more than adequate time for delivery from the other side of the planet, and have always received before need.  Can't wait?  See your Vet and pay the premium, you deserve to.

I've used this company for over two years and find they have the best price for Revolution (Stronghold). Shipping, if I remember correctly, takes about two weeks. The company had a problem at one point where items were being held by customs for an extraordinarily long time. The company sent me an email informing me of the problem and I believe it was posted on their site as well. Since then I've placed two other orders and had no problems at all. Once, when I found one of the capsules had been broken, they issued me a credit immediately. I've not experienced any fraudulent charges from Australia to my credit card.
I think they are great,Low prices,fast delivery.will order again.Thank you.

Our dog Ruthie has had problems since she was just a few month old.  She has been in and out of the hospital.  She has had to have multiple x rays, seen a neurologist, undergone an  MRI, and been on pretty expensive medicine for almost a year now.  We are so thankful for Petplan.  They have been there the whole way with the treatments for Ruthie.  It has always been a very easy process and they pay right away no extra questions asked.  I am forever grateful for Petplan, without them we would be in a huge amount of debt.  Now we can care for our dog and not have any added stress worrying about how we can afford it!

I’m so glad I signed up for Petplan Pet insurance for my dog Kimber. Not even four years old, she needed surgery to remove multiple lumps from her back and legs. One thing I didn’t need to worry about was how I was going to be able to afford her surgery. Within days of submitting my claim, a check was in the mail. The claim submission process was quick and easy. Worth every penny!
Petplan is the best! Very affordable, easy to use, great service.
The best insurance out there. I was not a fan of pet insurance but am soooo glad I did this.  They did everything that was promised and helped us get our dog through his surgery.

I honestly am so upset at myself for not doing research before going with PetPlan. My dog has been relatively healthy up to this point (9 years) but lately has had some issues with recurring bladder infections as well as heart issues. EVERY single time I submit a claim with PetPlan, I get an email saying my claim will be reviewed within 10 - 15 business days. I've not once had a claim reviewed and finalized earlier than ONE MONTH!. Not only that, they currently owe me about $1,200 over three claims and one cheque (around $600) I have been waiting for for TWO MONTHS!!! This is completely unacceptable for a business to run this way. I am now experiencing some financial hardships and really need this reimbursement but every time I reach out to them they come up with one excuse after the other (the mail must have gotten lost, etc.). I have never had any mail get lost so there is no way this can happen twice in a row. Honestly, if it wasn't that I could never live with myself if my dog got seriously ill and I didn't have coverage, I would have cancelled months ago. DO NOT GO WITH PETPLAN!

I had heard about petplan from other people and thought that their structure was credible and straight forward to work with. Their reimbursement format is sketchy. I had insured our cat (30$ per month) and had incurred over 600$ in bills from two vet visits. When submitted for claims, they got rejected missing documents which I had already uploaded online. Customer support is extremely unhelpful and does not clarify what they need to process the claim. We are doing okay for where we are and honestly it's not worth the hassle haggling with petplan if you can look at alternatives which work with vets directly.
I’ve been with pet plan for almost a year. My pup is prone to several health conditions and sees the vet a fair bit. I have always received my reimbursement quickly and with minimal hassle.
Petplan is a very good company and I am very grateful they exist.

I wish we could give ZERO STARS. DO NOT TRUST THE 5 STAR Reviews... they are NOT REAL. I've been paying this insurance for a few years now and recently my GSD had an injury and we noticed him panting heavy. We took him in to get his heart checked and his leg and hip. After tests it showed his heart was fine and they couldn't find anything wrong in the X-rays on his leg, hip was fine. So the doctor referred us to an Orthopedic to get his ligaments checked. But first I wanted to send in the claim for the tests. Well guess what I found out... PetPlan takes forever to get back to you, and then just asked for more documentation and then gets back to you again for more documentation only to turn around and tell you it's not covered. They are the WORST...ALSO THE RATES GO UP EVERY YEAR.. THIS YEAR 165.00 PER MONTH.... THAT DOESN'T COVER ANYTHING!  DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS .....

If you try to put a claim in Pet Plan does everything in their power not to pay.  My dog had surgery and need to go to ER per his regular vet's instructions less than 48 hours later.  He was having complications due to surgery/medications his primary vet and I believed.  Petplan insists that since they found a UTI in addition to side effects from post-surgery meds that the deductible must be met again.  It is all tied together as were the tests but again they are screwing their customers.  If my dog was not so old I would change companies.  The new underwriters have made this one of the worst companies to buy insurance from.  For those of you who have not started with this company USE ANOTHER COMPANY.  DO NOT BUY FROM THIS COMPANY.

I have been with petplan for 14 years but since they got a new underwriter life has changed. I have a 14 year old who has been healthy until the last year where he incurred a lot of medical expenses but has pulled through the issue. When came time for his annual renewal petplan raised my premium from $1642 to $3,600. Petplan won't cancel you but they will raise your premium to try to force you to cancel your policy. It seems as though they only want to insure healthy pets. Be sure when looking for a insurance company that they do not base your premium on number of claims and age of your dog. Petplan also has the right to change your coverage at any time. I also had a friend who had her coverage reduced due to having a back issue with her dog

How much are you willing to spend to make sure your four-legged baby is healthy, happy, and safe? I'm glad I don't know the answer - because it's probably everything in my savings account, all my credit cards, and my right arm. I still have both arms and no debt thanks to PetPlan's coverage of my beloved puppy. Brody, less than two years old, is suffering from a serious muscular condition that has caused him intense pain, exhaustion, and muscle-atrophy all over his body. He is the happiest dog on earth, and it has been awful to watch. Unfortunately, he did not respond well to the usual treatment options and after almost two months of trying different things, we eventually ended up in the emergency room. After a couple days in the hospital and a neurological consultation, Brody is on a revised "get healthy" plan and improving slowly each day. Between the vet visits, the recurring bloodwork, the prescriptions, anesthesia for exams (too painful to do without), a cancelled vacation due to emergency treatment needs, emergency room bills, and everything else that may be coming our way, we were (and are) looking at thousands of dollars in care. PetPlan has been there since Day One. When Brody first received a diagnosis, I called PetPlan to make sure I understood where we were headed financially. The first thing the person asked me was, "How are you and Brody holding up?" That's how all my interactions with PetPlan have gone - they ask first about our well-being, then answer any questions openly, honestly, and quickly (I've never waited to speak to a real person). The most recent time I spoke with a PetPlan representative, I called in a panic because the bill for Brody's emergency room visit and subsequent hospital stay was a big burden and the hospital refused to work with PetPlan for payment directly (they required it up front). The person I spoke to at PetPlan - once again, asked how Brody was doing - and then assured me that she understood the issue completely and would do everything she could to get the claims expedited. They were approved and a check was in the mail within 48 hours of that conversation. I can't say enough positive things about my experience with PetPlan, and I hope this story encourages you that it's the right option. I know other doggie-parents who have had very different situations, and I am so glad that PetPlan has never asked me to choose between Brody's well-being (or even his life) and my financial stability.

Have had 3 separate policies (2 cats, 1 Dog) with Petplan for several years at a cost of $1600+ per year. Just made my first claim ever in the amount of $700 before deductible. It was denied because we went 15 months between checkups instead of the required 12 months. 3 policies now cancelled.

Had them for 2 years never used it. Got the 90% coverage dog went blind had the $6000 surgery filled claim and was denied. Modern day snake oil salesmen only its paper and a promise. They hide behind small print and what is illegal insurance tactics for people in their policies and coverage. Save your money ask friends and family for help start a go fund me. Don't waste your money

I just got off the phone with Sarah, a Pet Plan customer service provider, and as ALWAYS was impressed with the quick and capable handling of my questions.  I've had Pet Plan for many years and I too experienced the underwriter change, but have zero complaints.  My Golden Doodle has had many claims in his 9 years and every single one was handled exactly the way I was promised it would.  I choose to mail in my claims and would advise anybody to collect a copy of every chart note generated about your pet as you get your reciept (invoice) for that service.  I've never had any problems with any service provider, not once. Recently, we had two larger claims including one for an emergency procedure to untwist my dog's stomach (GDV).  This is an expensive procedure without which he would have died.  I honestly don’t know where we would be without Pet Plan.  Pet Plan has played as big a role in in our dog’s health, well being and happiness as any who love, play with and help watch over him. I am forever grateful to Pet Plan and wholeheartedly recommend them to anyone.  It's as close as you're going to get to feeling like your own family has your back.

I cannot possibly say enough about Petplan. I have had Petplan for three of my dogs.  Petplan paid for surgery and radiation for my golden retriever.  Petplan also paid for expensive medicine and initial and ongoing tests related to my sheltie's heart disease, as well acupuncture and laser therapy (I think they reimbursed me close to $30,000 during her 12 years of life!).  Now I have a lab mix and she just needed surgery for elbow dysplasia and they paid for that. The claim process is simple and reimbursement is fast.  I tell everyone I know who has a pet or thinking of getting one that they should get pet insurance, and I HIGHLY recommend Petplan.  It is peace of mind when your furry family member needs medical treatment.  I am so thankful for Petplan.

Good luck joining PetPLan, make sure you know ALL your pets 'pre existing' conditions, along with inventing time travel then you should be sweet. We did not know our pet had a ‘pre-existing condition’, we are not trained vets.  It would have been good if, as insurers, records were checked from the Vets and THEN discussed recommended changes in the policy as we signed up so we knew, no surprises.  We found this out AFTER a claim was made which was denied.  Brilliant. We had a very negative experience with PetPlan, I would not recommend PetPlan.

I literally feel like I have been scammed by Petplan. Short story: Every year you must do a wellness exam, which is not covered, and if they find anything wrong with your dog it is considered a pre-existing condition. Even if the previous exam she was fine. You have 0 chance at all to get reimbursed for anything that matter. Long story: I have been with them for more than 5 years since my dog was 6 months old. My dog being healthy, we only filled a claimed once 3-4 years ago without any issue at all. A month ago my dog seems to be a bit low on energy, doesn't eat at much as she used to, ect. Nothing too worrisome yet, but I decided to take her to the vet to check it out. They are not able to actually find anything clear, so they asked us to do further testing at a specialist vet. The only appointment available was a month later. During that time, my dog condition gets worse and worse, so 2 weeks later we must bring her to the emergency room. The hospital discovered that she has Addison diseases (which is a Congenital disorder). Since I was with Petplan for 5 years, and that I submitted claimed before without issue, I was certain they will cover this. Of course not, they told me that since she had not had a yearly wellness exam, they will use the first vet visit as the wellness exam. So I am thinking, no worries the first visit to the vet would be the wellness exam. That will not be reimbursed, but the visit to the hospital will be. Still not, since she had "signs" of it, then the entire episode is not cover. On top of that, they are telling me that now anything related to Addison diseases will not be covered in the future since the wellness exam is now the baseline. So they are considering my dog's diseases a PRE-EXISTING condition. I am with them for 5 years!!! I got insurance a month after getting our dog! How can this be a pre-existing condition? I failed to see how a yearly wellness exam would have detected Addison disease. Addison’s is difficult to trace and can not be detected at all thru a regular checkup. Only until there is a major crisis can vers even detect anything wrong And keep in mind that my dog had an exam when she left the shelter and I first got the insurance, it is not like they never had a baseline. The entire point to get an assurance so early on and paying a premium every year without ever using it was exactly to cover for this kind of issues. So basically every year you must do a wellness exam, which is not covered, and if they find anything wrong with your dog it is considered a pre-existing condition. Even if the previous exam was entirely fine. You have 0 chance at all to get reimbursed for anything that truly matters.

Remember that pet plan is insurance. And they are a business. So while they don’t treat  pre-existing conditions and they do not treat health and wellness check ups. They definitely reimburse you when your pet is sick or has an emergency. My cat Mizu never had a problem until recently and it has been so nice knowing that I can get Mizu the best care and not have to worry financially. They have reimburse me 80% of all the money that I have spent at my vet.  Also,  I recommend getting pet insurance when your animal is little so that they do cover everything if something should arise.  And trust me, eventually it does.

Pet plan is very easy to deal with. Our claim was handled promptly. I filed the claim online uploading our bill with the vet facing the medical information. They answer their phones 24 hours a day with the person answering the phone able to retrieve your information. You can tailor your plan to suit your needs with choices of deductible and percentage paid. Highly recommend pet plan

Where do I begin? This company is borderline criminal. They take your information, aggregate the data to add other random profiles to yours, confusing the information, violating your privacy and ultimately cheating you out of money for canceled services and stolen items from our home. Go with trusted, reputable boarding services and walkers. Your pets are worth it!

I just moved to the city and my dog is super anxious most of the time. He has separation anxiety and loves to jump. But he is my child and i love him. After putting in all the information i could into the app, his walker could not have done a better job. She texted me during their walk. Gave me updates. and sent me a picture. All of my dog mom instructions were followed and she was super sweet to my boy.

Was good until it got very dangerous I really enjoyed working for WAG for 1.5 years. I walked many dogs and had a 5 star rating from customers. This was until I got bitten by a dog and had serious damage to my hand. WAG and the dog owners do not help pay for medical bills or any damages. On top of that, they do not require dog owners to disclose any important safety information about the dog..... when I asked if they could do that to protect people walking dogs they said they will NOT. That is EXTREMELY SKETCHY and I do not feel safe walking dogs now that they don't care about our well-being whats so ever. I understand not paying as a third party contractor. What I don't understand is they do NOTHING to protect their walkers. DANGER DANGER DANGER.

Wag is reliable about 75% of the time. Don't bother to schedule a walk on a Sunday morning, it will get canceled 14 times because their walkers sign up for walks, then stay out drunk on Saturday night, and cancel the Sunday morning walk. I've had walks scheduled for 8 am Sunday morning that didn't get filled until after 12 pm that day because of this, and it is like clockwork. Similarly, some of their walkers are unreliable and instead of doing some background work to fully service the customer's request, Wag will just cancel your walk and leave your dog unattended. Last weekend, I was in Puerto Rico and had a walker scheduled for 7 pm. He showed up, claimed he needed a code to get into my apartment, even though there is no code and there is a 24-hour concierge with a key, so Wag just canceled the walk. I then had to spend over 2 hours on and off the phone with them to get a walk rescheduled for my dog that didn't show up until 11:30 that night. This is not reliable service and no mom and pop business would be able to operate this way and stay in business. I will definitely be scaling my use of the service WAYYYYY back since this final straw. FYI, I've spent thousands of dollars on Wag, I prefer to spend my money at this point on a service I can rely on.

My dog loves her walker and I love having someone caring and responsible taking care of my dog while I am at work.  The Wag app allows me to monitor the walk and I always look forward to the report card at the end of the walk.
Great app great service!!
Walkers are in time and enthusiastic.
Love this service easy, convenient and that are great with my older dog.
Ann has been a terrific walker. She has been timely, friendly, and truly seems to care for my dog. I would highly recommend her, and Wag! in general.
All of the walkers have been great. I have always received timely responses to my requests for a walker!
Love this app! The walkers have all been great and if there were any issues the support staff at wag is super helpful.
Love my wag walkers!

I have been very happy with Wag! I use a walker daily for my pups while I am at work to make sure no accidents in the house. It saves me a trip home and I have peace of mind. They have also helped me in a pinch if I have schedule changes and need someone right away.

I love my walker Peggy. She is one of my trusted Walkers. She knows my dog Zola very personally and I appreciate her always having an open conversation about her after their walks. Love Wag. My dog appreciates it.
Wag! has been amazing! We have always had wonderful walkers that truly care for our dogs. I love getting their report cards after a walk!
I trust Wag to provide the care for my pup.  All walkers have been terrific and the service is consistently reliable. It is easy and reasonably priced.
Mickey has the best times with my walkers while I drive for lyft
Very nice people and Rocky loves to walk with them.

I have used Wag in 2 different states and I am always pleased! The walkers are always on time and super nice! They always take pictures and give detailed reviews in the report card. I like the peace of mind I get when being able to GPS locate where they are walking, and also the indicators that Wag gives to let the owner know that the dog pooped, peed, and the door was locked. I don’t know what I’d do without Wag!
walkers always take time to get to know my pups often have to convince one to walk. They even sit with the one who will not walk after returning the others. I would recommend them to friends.
My dog definitely loves the playology toys ... It's really fun to see him sniff around to find them to! Ordering was easy, arrival was fairly quick, and they are definitely thoughtfully made for dogs
Playology is the ONLY brand that keeps my pitbull busy without destroying their toys! They even helped me find the last bit of bacon scented toys for my dog since apparently that is all she is into!
Jax absolutely loves his ball & bone. He even hides them when he’s not playing with them so no one can touch them. It’s so funny! Thank you so much

I've already written a review here, but if you want another, here, ya go -   The large blue bone is the only toy, of the innumerable ones I've provided to my pit/lab, that the dog cannot destroy.  Well, not for 6 months or so of chewing.  He's on his second one, when, after 7 months on the first one he managed to tear off a small piece off one of the knobs on the end.  I don't want him swallowing plastic stuff because he throws it up all over the bedroom. He demolished a Nyla-bone #10 in a day; ground it up into tiny pieces, swallowed them, threw them up...no joy. These toys are great for serious chewers.  We gave a donut and a bone to our daughter's pit bull and she loves them.
Bought more toys and they are the most fought over.
My dog has torn through the toys within days of getting them.
Service and all was great but not one of my four dogs likes or plays with the four toys I purchased.
my hound dog loves it! she lays on her back and gnaws on it-keep trying to catch a picture to post! Highly recommended.
Great rope toy

Love love love! We have at least one of every toy available. She does have her preference (squeaky ball!) but enjoys them all. She doesn't seem to have a preference on the scents (yes we have all of them!). The small ball is the perfect size for her (15 lb boston terrier). Very happy with all the products! The handwritten thank you note in the package is a nice touch. :)
Both dogs are treat motivated but did not care too much for the cheddar ball or the peanut butter rope.

If we give our dogs a basket of toys they always choose anything made by Playology.  Every toy is worth it. They have also lasted the longest. Great gifts too! They love the red/beef and orangish-yellow/cheddarcheese. Yellow/chicken and black/bacon are second/third.
The supposed peanut butter smelling toy smelled like mold.  1 minute after checking it out, my dog has no desire to even look at it any further.
Imy dog chewed bone immediately. Contacted company they replaced bone with a tougher ring. He is still chewing on and loves it
The product was supposed to smell like bacon. It smells like rubber. The dog is not even remotely interested.

I have a one year old Bull Terrier who can destroy most anything, except for the Playology toys we have given her. She has three Playology toys at the moment. Her favorite is the peanut butter squeaker toy. We can not believe it is still in great shape and still squeaks. These are the best dog toys. I can not wait for another squeaker toy to be available. Thank you Playology. Definitely money well spent.
My 3.5 pond Yorkie loves his Playology Ball! It is just the right size for him to carry and chase and it's unpredictable movements keep his interest! Like Cat-Nip for dogs!!!

I bought the small bone with beef scent just to try. We have 5 dogs and the German shepherd ruins everything in minutes. Well he has been chewing on it for a month and it still looks brand new. I went back and bought a squeaky toy and a rope in his large size. I didn't have much hope for the squeaky toy but we play tug of war with it and it's fine. I will always buy Playology from now on.

My 7 dogs loved the bone shaped ones aren't to keen on the circles. But they have been playing with the bones regularly and still not a dent in them. Usually)y the toy would be in the trash torn up by now. Great product
Good balls. Dogs haven’t been able to chew them up yet.

Something has gone wrong here. They were great for months, but earlier this summer, a late-ish delivery and now one that is a month late. Ok finally I got it. Did not know they were in Florida their site has no address. So someone finally called me after Hurricane Irma to let me know. I appreciate that.  I originally gave a bad review but now I'm taking that review down and giving you 4 stars. Thanks for the product. ☺

Ordered product, received confirmation email that they are getting package ready and would email when ready to ship. 7 days later, no further emails and no package. Tried calling but automated answer says to leave a message. Shouldn't take 7 days to ship anything if you have the product on hand. This will be the last time shopping here. Not really saving money if you don't receive the product in a timely manor and have to buy locally so your pets are covered.

I am very frustrated as I write this review. I order Azodyl for my cat last Thursday and paid for second day air and the cooler case. When I checked the mail today, still no product and I went online and all I see is the order is confirmed - not even shipped yet.  This is very unacceptable - every time I ordered this medicine online with any other company the order shipped that day or the next.  Now my cat will be without the medication for a few days as I await its arrival.  I went with IdealPetX because their price was a few dollars less expensive but obviously not worth it.  I will not order again from them and am waiting to hear when it is shipping or if I need to cancel the order and go with my usual company Allivet.  That's what I get for trying to save a couple of dollars - the meds are expensive $83 with shipping but learn and lose.

I purchased three bottles of as azodyl which is supposed to stay cold. I also purchased a cooler and a cold pack so it would stay cool. I paid $20 for expedited shipping. I called numerous times they tell me to leave my name and number because they're too busy to take my call haven't heard back from anyone. They should be easier to contact.

We tried some of Hackthedog’s products and we were thoroughly impressed. The shampoo has been excellent for the skin of my itch dogs, and has managed to keep up with everything from mud and sand to horse poo! The food went down a storm, from the second I opened the packet I had three pups performing every trick they know for my attention and a chance for a bite. As it’s freeze dried, limited ingredients and very low in carbs I’m confident it’s good even for my itchiest of pups.

We tested the food a week ago and my boys loved it! We stired it with warm water and the boys cleaned every piece in their bowls 😅 We also love the cute little dogs on the packaging, maybe there is a way to pack it with paper instead of plastic but this just a little idea 😘 We feed our boys fresh and raw, and when we are on weekend adventures or journeys its always a problem what we should feed. But this food is ideal for travelers also cause its nearly has no weight. So if you are on a Trekkingtour and want to feed something good to your dog... Here you go! ❤️❤️❤️ If you want to see our boys, look on Instagram #raythemix

Personally experienced the additional mile Agota goes when consulting a dog's parents on difficult health and nutrition questions. Clearly the same passion & dedication goes towards the creation of the products. Keep up the good work - pups need more initiatives like this one!

I'm very glad that I met Agota. Her honesty and support helped a lot in a very hard moment I was. That's how I started changing my dogs diet because of the problems she had. Wish vet doctors were more like you are ;)

Thank you for your sincere consultation about our dog's food! Agota is just simply amazing. So passionate and devoted! You can instantly sense from the way she speaks how deeply and truly she is concerned about the health and happiness of all dogs.

The product arrived faster than expected and both me and my dog Roxy were keen to try it out! We’ve used it several time now and Roxy stopped scratching her fur and it seems that she doesn’t have dandruff anymore. Thanks to Hack The Dog!

First off this shampoo is AMAZING. Yes it has a strong scent straight out of the bottle but afterwards there is NO fruity/floral scent, just a clean version of your animals scent (if that makes any sense?). I washed my dog twice with this shampoo but from now on only one round is needed since it lathers like expensive shampoos you'd get at a hair salon! This shampoo also helped loosen the excess undercoat and her Furminator brush went through like a sharp knife in butter. She is short/medium haired and it's always been mostly course/dry feeling with or without baths, after this bath her fur is thick and soft and not coarse/dry. Her skin looks AMAZING and the allergic reaction from the flea bites is gone, plus Sraige( eng. snail) isn't licking herself endlessly like she usually does after a bath

I choose to have it shipped by UPS because USPS will not deliver directly to my physical address (SC). I was excited to receive this product within 2 days. Not only did it take a day extra to arrive here, but it arrived at the local post office and they decided to ship it back to the carrier (out in CA). It has been 8 days since I have ordered this product and I am still waiting on my product. When I called customer service, I was told I will be getting a full refund of the product, including the shipping cost, but when I called back and spoke to a different colleague (Shahzabi), I was told that I will only get a free refund of the $15 shipping cost. I am very frustrated with their customer service and how this could of ever happened. I hope this company will make good on their promises.
Fairly often, the device shows Pauli at home when she is not.  It is like the safe area has been widely expanded. Locating her has worked well except for that.

10-30-19 All hooked up but one of my trackers doesn't track but I get a text every 20 seconds telling me it's still trying which runs my phone battery down. REALLY bad first day!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 10-31-19 I called tech support yesterday and apparently they were able to resolve my issue in one call. It worked this morning as promised. Nice save!

I tried to purchase a replacement “rubber” whistle 3 collar attachments... the website listed the collar attachments as “available in 2 weeks”. I returned in 2 weeks and purchased the “1 X WHISTLE 3 – ADDITIONAL SNAP COLLAR ATTACHMENTS” only to find they are no longer made of rubber and do not fit my dog’s collar securely. The new clasp locks tightly on to the collar but the whistle no longer locks securely to the new clasp making it easy for the whistle to fall off.  The clasp requires a lot of fidgeting to get the whistle to lock on. I LOVE my WHISTLE 3 and the security it gave me. This “One Size Fits All” plastic collar clasp is not a good solution for my dog. Now I am insecure about my dog‘s safety again.  I will try to 3D print something that works better. Be prepared for this clasp to give you problems or not work at all on a large breed cotton dog collar. It seems that the collar’s cotton material prevents the clasp spring mechanism from closing properly. I wish the rubber clasps were still available.

Cody was knowledgeable, personable, and professional.  He reflects well upon your organization!   It is unfortunate that the product was defective, but he ordered a replacement, which should be here soon.
and the new clips for the dog collars are much more secure which I appreciate!
I appreciated the prompt response to my issue.  It all turned out fine.  I also appreciated the follow up email.
Ordering new charging cables was simple and quick. Best retail customer service around! Love you guys!!!
Service has been slow. We ordered last week and have not yet received our new whistle.
The young lady, Debbie, was very helpful and would not let me give up. I was using an iPad and iPhone which complicated matters but Debbie was able to do the job. Kudos to her.

Although it was frustrating not being able to purchase this product for several months when my cat needed it, I'm changing my review to five stars, now that we have been using Derma-ionx for a month.  It is so easy to put a few drops in her water bowl, so no wrestling with kitty is required.  She has very little itching and irritation on her skin now, and I can see that she is so much more comfortable.  I think this product will be a good preventive measure against allergic skin flare-ups for Cheyenne.  I don't ever want to go back to products the vet suggested, which further irritated her skin.  This one works!

I have been a VETiONX customer for many years.  When my GSD was diagnosed with hip dysplasia at 2 even my vet said Ace would live a relatively short life of 8 years or less, that was 11 1/2 years ago.  We tried all the natural joint supplements with no success.  One day I stumbled onto the VETiONX site and thought, 'what do I have to loose'.   A million thank yous!!!!!
All I can say is that it was easy ordering! I hope the product works as good!

VETiONX speaks for itself. The customer service is great, the products are high quality and sure help. You need assistance, the staff is there for you. I rescued a Golden Retriever, who was in bad shape. I was told he might lived another 2 years. His skin was bad, his muscles and joins hurt him, you name it. Well I changed his food and medication. I used just VETiONX products (like, DERMA-iONX, PROMAXOL, ARTHRO-iONX, Omega 3/6/9, VitaCanine, DEFENDEX). My cooper died of the age of 16 years and 2 month, 2 years became 9 wonderful unforgettable years. VETiONX did its part, they sure helped. Thank you.
Very good company to deal with i  have used them a few times never had a problem. The products I used are for my dogs and they do help a lot.
We have used Arthroionx for our Belgian Makinois (who has hip dysplasia) for the last few years — and it has reversed her major issue.  It works!!
I can't really see a big improvement but I am using the product on a barn cat which is very difficult to monitor.

Right now I'm on the fence, sorry ... Within the first 48 hours, the liquid elimination was reduced by Half!  I was So happy:  Then the backslide.... Maybe it was too late for him.  He is still with us,  however,  after only two days of perk, he's down .... Sleeping All the time, except for feeding and when I can let them all outdoors,  supervised. I would certainly appreciate any advice about increase /decrease of dosage .... He started off @10lbs and is steadily losing weight.... He did not react well to the insulin injection so I am giving him cbd oil. Thank you for your valuable time and consideration

Amazing results! As soon as I started using VetIonX on my 11 year old Yorkie her pre-diabetic symptions vanished.  Already had two dogs become diabetic and didn't want this one to suffer too.  Last night she didn't get her dose accidentally and woke me twice during the night for water and to go out.  Otherwise, she's fine through the night!
Great service, fast respond and shipment. The products of that company gave life back to my dogs.

I usually love your product but I don’t like the product now. I liked the liquid better. The little pellets are awful. Do you not have the liquid anymore. I don’t know if I will buy this again because it is not liquid.
My dogs absolutely love the product! It was easy to order and shipped quickly.
My dog doesn't take medicine very well but he took your product without any problem.  He enjoys taking it thinking it's a treat.
Product arrived quickly and exactly as ordered. I prefer the new pellet version vs the liquid as it is now easier to know if my dog receives the full dose.
Product does provide symptom relief for our cat diagnosed with diabetes over a year ago.

Flea Battle I have been battling fleas all spring and was at my wits end. Decided to look for natural products to help since all other methods failed. I found Vetionx through my doggie daycare where my dog attends and ordered the Defendex Red. What a game changer. It has worked. I also use the cedar guard. My daughter is actually allergic to cedar so I was a little nervous but red the FAQ's and realized its cedar oil not the pollen. So she has had no problems. We went from my dogs having a ton of fleas down to one or two fleas to now no fleas. I am beyond impressed with this product.

My first experience with this company.  Needed a unique and trusted product that would bring “some” relief to our 19 yr old male cat.   While a full cure is not likely, there has been some small improvement.   I’ll accept that.   All items arrived on time, well packed and very clear instructions.   We will continue to use this product and provide whatever small relief it offers.   Thank you for your clear website, order system and a product that appears to be very well thought out.

I purchased this pain reliever in hopes that it would help my 15 1/2 yr heeler mix with pain of arthritis.   The vet had changed her pain meds and it wasn't working really well.   On a single dose a day.  It gave her no relief.   So I doubled the dosage to am and pm.   I used the recommended dose of 3/4 tsp.   I had to mix it with a small amount of can dog food or she wouldn't take it.   It helped some but did not give the relief of her original pain meds of carprophen.   So I went to another vet and he recommended that I put her back on that.   At this point in her treatment... it is necessary to keep her comfortable.    This probably would help with a younger dog with less problems.
Good company to do business with. Wide variety of products at reasonable prices.
Very informative and helpful.
Awesome gift!  My daughter loved them and was so happy to have something to remind her puppies at home.

I have ordered successfully from PupSocks a number of times, with great results.  However, they made a mistake on my last order (for a wedding gift, which will now not arrive on time) and it has been IMPOSSIBLE to get it resolved.  No one responds in a timely fashion via email, and they seemingly aren’t paying too much attention when they do respond, as they reprinted the wrong sock with the wrong face the second time around.  I am still waiting for any response or confirmation that the correct item will be produced and sent.  Perhaps this will bring some attention to the matter.  I have tried every possible way to be in touch.  Needless to say, this experience is really disappointing.  Horrible customer service.

The advertising for quick shipping didn’t apply to me. It has been three weeks and I still haven’t received my package. I had to email the company at week 2 to figure out if I should get a refund or not. It is only then that they told me they were having an issue. I understand things happen but at least let your customers know! Overall very disappointed since this was a birthday gift for my husband and he still hasn’t received it.
The picture of my dog that sent did not match what was on the socks, doesn't even look like my dog, very disappointed.
They are so cool!  My kids are going to love them.
I have ordered a number of PupSocks custom socks and like the product. Just have to be careful to select the number of faces wanted to be on the socks.
The pictures came out really great and i got the socks delivered so quickly (ordered monday night, and they were here friday). Socks are good quality too.
Great quality
Got some socks for a friend. Absolutely LOVED them!!! They were spot on!
They are perfect!!!
These are the cutest socks. I want one for all my friends and their pets.
The person who received the socks was very delighted. She said best birthday gift ever!
My husband LOVES them! Slam dunk best birthday gift for him!
Super fast delivery. I sent them as a bday gift to a friend. She loved the socks!
The socks are so adorable and received quickly!

I was expecting more for ~$30 socks. I'm not a fan of the material the socks are made out of. The stitching was also "off" on my socks and the heel of the stitching came to the front of the sock too. I ended up getting a refund on my socks but I'm disappointed that the quality was so subpar to begin with. For the record, the socks themselves are made in China -- only the printing is done in the USA... so their advertising is a bit deceitful in that way. Not that it matters since 90% of what we have in the US is made elsewhere but I find the deceit in the company's advertising a bit problematic.
Bought these as a last-minute wedding day gift for my husband & he loved them! They came quickly and were everything I could have imagined!

Horrible customer service! Charged me, then 10 days go by, no item. I call. They say my vet wouldn't authorize. Yet no communication. So, I tell them I'll mail a script. I guess this is how they have such low prices? Never again. Plus, you'll get so much spam once you give your email. It's pretty shady.

I ordered cat Food July 22, on July 23 you sent me an email stating you would notify me when the order shipped. On July 29, I received a voicemail from you stating that the product was back ordered and would not ship till around August 1, and did still want the order, I said yes. So that suggests that you didn’t know the cat food was back ordered from July 22 when you receive the order until July 29, when you call me? Seven days without any communications about the order is unacceptable. Knowing we would not have enough food to last until maybe August 2nd or third, on July 29 I placed an order for cat food from Chewy.com, within about two hours I received an email from Chewy.com stating that the order has shipped. On the morning of July 31 (two days later) I received the order from Chewy.com. That’s called communications and service.
Don't let them have your email address or you'll get tons of spam.  If you try to unsubscribe, they won't do it.
Awesome super fast shipping

How can these guys have 80% of their clientele give them 5 starts? I places an order 3 weeks ago, it took KV over a week to make the phone call to my vet only to tell me there was an issue. Finally, on week 4 I get shipping notification of KV bucks?! Who cares?! The meds order will take another month! Standard stuff!! I’m done with KV

I ordered a medication for my dog online that they said they had and mailed the prescription.  2 weeks later I got a call saying that they do not have the medication.  Why did they not update their website like other suppliers do.  Now I have wait to get my script back and start all over with another supplier.  Meanwhile, my dog is going without

The level of terrible customer service where the pharmacy is concerned is astounding to me. I have been using KV vet supply for awhile now, due to their very fair price point on medications. However EVERY SINGLE TIME I have had to place an order, I have to call to get updates. Either they don't contact my vet at all, contact the wrong vet or this last just cancel an order for Vetmedin all together and not notify me. Having three dogs with CHF, I need a pharmacy that is more reliable than this and for the final time KV Vet supply has proven to me they just are NOT reliable. I am willing to pay more money at this point so that I can work with a company that actually knows how to provide good customer service.

I run a non profit rescue/adoption organization and needed a medication for one of our foster animals. I found the product and then had to call customer service to get our non profit status approved so we wouldn't be charged tax. Justine, the customer service rep, told me to send our 501 c 3. There is no such document. We received our Letter of Determination when we were approved by the IRS in 1997. It's the only document that unequivocally shows our non profit status. I don't remember how long it took for her to inform me that I sent the wrong document. What's more important than our federal paperwork? They wanted a document from the state. So I sent the Cert 119 which is the state approved form to use to make purchases with all merchants in my state. They didn't want that either. They wanted the W9 form which is just a *request* to the IRS for our tax payer number. I sent that form days ago and haven't heard back. Meanwhile, I've had to go elsewhere for our foster dog's medication. I will NEVER shop here. Again, the worst customer service ever, particularly since this was urgent, we needed a prescribed medication by our dog's veterinarian for Cushing's Disease. Absolutely no sense of urgency on Justine's part. She and KV Supply get a 0. This site won't post the review unless I provide a rating. I'm clicking one star only because my review won't post otherwise.

Horrible customer service. My dog needs heart medication and I should have ordered sooner, but it took over a week for them to ship it, and it will be 11 days before I have it, assuming they sent the right stuff and it gets here.  My dog will be without his meds for a week. The pharmacy was inept, and the company did not call me to update me even when they assured me they would. I will never use them again.

Horrible, horrible, horrible. I had my vet fax them the prescription for Proin and Bravecto, and my first order was filled and shipped.  When it was time for a refill, I ordered early enough so we wouldn't run out.  Got an email  about a week after I placed the order saying there would be a slight delay because the pharmacy was being redone and updated.  So I went to my vet and got the meds.  Then, they changed the status of my order to say "This item will process and ship after Prescriptions are approved. All prescriptions will not be fulfilled until approved by your veterinarian."  I called and spoke with a lady who tried to tell me the order showed shipped and when I told her no, it showed pending, she said she would check into it and call me back.  Never happened.  Now, almost 2 weeks later, and 3 unanswered emails and inquiries, the status of the order is still pending.  Horrible customer service.

In 2018 I placed three orders with KV Supply. Two of those orders were badly managed that resulted in my dogs having to go without their medicine, one was for a heart condition and the other for arthritis, for a number of days. The latest order issues were that one of the medicines was on backorder and the other they couldn't locate the authorization which had been faxed to them. I wasn't informed of either of these issues until after checking online and seeing that the order status noted that it had been shipped 9 days prior. When I called to inform them I had not received the order, I was informed about the backorder and lack of authorization. When dealing with medicines related to serious health issues of my pets, this is totally unacceptable and irresponsible conduct of a company purporting to be trustworthy and professional. KV Supply is neither! P. Miller

I have two dogs with arthritis, they need daily meds for relief.  I ordered meds, paid my bill, and waited 8 days for their meds.  Apparently, my vet never sent approval to KV.  I understand this problem.  What i am highly dissatisfied with is the fact that KV never called me to tell me there was a problem.  I trusted them to follow through and they did not.  This has caused undue pain for my pets, and, that makes me very upset.

They are incompetent.  Called to place a prescription refill, she said she couldn't place the order that night (5:45 pm).  Called the next day, that person couldn't find my account! It took her literally 15 minutes! Once she found it, it was another 10 minutes to complete the order.  This is the last in a series of similar dealings with them, we're switching to another pharmacy.
Dog medications  always available, never out if stock. Plus the medications are at a low affordable prices. Shipping extremely fast! Received package 2 days after placing order!

I just spoke with the rudest customer service rep I've ever experienced.  I work in customer service.  I understand dealing with crazy people can grate on a person, but I somehow manage to be civil and professional.  The snark in this woman's voice was incredibly uncalled for and beyond unprofessional.  I am not sure about the company in general, but reading these other reviews and having the experience I just had, I am pretty sure I won't be doing business with them again. I have yet to receive my order, since they don't seem to care that they haven't heard back from my vet.

Placed my first order with KV Supply for pet prescription items on 4/14/18.  Received email order confirmation on 4/15/18 and 2 day shipping notification emails from KV Supply and UPS on 4/16/18.  Items arrived today 4/18/18 in pristine condition inside a styrofoam container which was packed inside a sturdy shipping box marked "Perishible", "Fragile", "This End Up", and "Do not freeze". Have been getting this pet prescription filled by a few other BIG, reputable online pet websites for the last 6 years and none of them have ever been able to process my order, verify the prescription with my vet and get it to my door all within 4 days that include a weekend.  And none of them have ever packed the prescription items (8 bags of Lactated Ringer Solution/20 lbs), so securely.    And the price was the lowest online price I have found for this item.  NO COMPLAINTS here.

Is it possible to give zero stars? If you care for your pets find another vendor! Under new management the quality has dropped well below what is feasible. Almost a month to get my dogs prescription. Numerous phone calls emails resulted in more wait time.  I AM DONE

this company has no communication in house, They told me my order was not able to be filled at this time so I called to cancel to make sure, they shipped the item the next day, charged my paypal after I was told it would not be charged and after I had ordered this item from some where else.  Now I can not return it because its meds, I am out the money and have pills that expire and "they are sorry" please visit us again,,,over my dead body

Had to return an item. Called several times.  Never received a refund and keep getting a run around. Will never do business with them again. Not only lost $50 for my item, out of the item also,  but also return shipping money. Will never do business with them again

I got a petcube about 1.5 years ago, it stop working. I emailed, called I can not seem to get any support.  There are many products like this on the market, don't waste your time on petcube they do not support there  product.

Absolutely rubbish. I bought this a week ago from Petbarn in Australia. At first it was working okay. The live stream quality was really bad, like watching something with dial up internet, nothing but slow motion pixels moving across my screen which constantly had blurry colours interferring. Our internet connection is fantastic and we have never had an issue in the past, as we stream netflix daily. The 4 and 5 second clips were recorded with great quality but it would record EVERYTHING even when there was absolutely no sound or movement. Do you know how annoying it is having to individually delete 4 second clips that are recorded ALL DAY? I decided to upgrade to the optimal package which cost me $48USD as it promised to give me 30 second clips. Well well, much to my surprise it is STILL recording 4 and 5 second clips, no 30 second clips in sight. And to top it off, today, I haven't been able to log in all day as it keeps saying 'timeout' or 'data synchronization fail'. I am angry I wasted $200AUD to buy this stupid device, and then a further $48USD to 'upgrade' to what appears to be the worst product I've ever bought. Do yourself a favour and buy a baby monitor and stay well away from this crap product.

Had this about a month so far. Immediately noticed it didnt come with the bag of treats it was supposed to. No big deal. I had some on hand and I fire off an email. It was late on a Friday so I didnt expect to hear back before Monday. Stuff gets forgotten in packaging, it happens.  I signed up for the Petcare and was getting push notifications non stop. Check the account and notice it is constantly uploading videos even when no one (including the dog) were home. Watch one of the +60 video recorded past midnight and notice some sort of electrical interference the mic was picking up. So I fire off another email and turn off noise recording and push notifications (negating the entire reason I signed up for the $30 petcare). Sent the second email Saturday, day after first email, and again expect to hear something by Monday. Fast forward a week and still havent hear back from my emails. Ok, I'll call them. Sat on hold for 5 minutes and got the option for them to call back once someone is available. I opt for that. Now, 10 days later, still no call back. Still no return email. Still no items that were supposed to be in the box. Still no resolution on electrical noise. If customer service sucked but it worked as advertised, I'm good. If it didnt work but customer service was trying to fix it, I'm good. But right now, it can do part of what is advertised and I get ghosted by CS. Unfortunately I bought this as a gift or I would have returned it by now.
Took a bit for my skittish dog to like it but I love it!! Nice to have an eye on him when I am away!
Inconsistent but I'm happy I got it.

Absolutely rubbish Video is jumpy sound is distorted and scratchy . Connection takes up to 2 minutes. Cuts out regularly. I have the fastest possible broadband speed in my country, and it still doesn’t work properly. Customer support is lousy. DONT BUY

I placed an order & received an email that they received the order.  I have never received anything from them since.  I have never received the dog food I ordered and when I sent an email inquiring, nobody ever got back to me. Would never order from this place again.
