Complete horseshit reviews below, be warned! Same exact writing style as his defensive replies to the one-star reviews on Amazon for the product.  And they are all "coincidentally" on either July 29, or August 12!  And they all say horseshit like "Wow, thanks to RenAvast from Bio Health Solutions..." Don't believe me, take just a GLANCE and try to convince yourself otherwise -- it's not hard to see! No wonder the FDA forced him out of the RenAvast title and to switch brands! I don't even care if the product works, this cannot be tolerated!  One star!

I already reviewed this under Aminavast, which is the current name for this product.  Then I discovered it also reviewed with even more reviews here.  Here's what I have to say. I do believe Nahmi was with me an extra year because of RenAvast (Aminavast). I had to wait until now to give my input, because I ....didn't want to "jinx" our situation by a good review too soon. Silly me, but I'm probably not the only one. My little one is gone now but I do believe he was with me an extra year because of RenAvast (Aminavast).. He was also getting fluids and epogen along with the RenAvast (Aminavast).. We had a touch and go time immediately after he was diagnosed. I had to syringe feed him, etc.. But then I started the RenAvast (Aminavast). and he rallied and began eating on his own. My vet said he was a miracle cat to be with me with his high numbers. It was heart failure that finally took us down. I am now giving it to my remaining kits who are all getting senior and developing elevated kidney values. I think they actually like the way it tastes. It's supposed be to tasteless but I've tried it myself and found that it seems to have ...all I can describe it as is a "rich" flavor. I mix a couple of capsules twice a day with a little plate of tuna and also mix with meds and baby food daily for a couple of my other kits. They gobble it right up. Just Google it. There are quite a few sources that sell.

RenAvast, now known as AminAvast has completely saved my cat Rambo's life. It is now 3 years since his diagnosis of CRF and my vet's suggestion to start him on AminAvast. All his kidney values went down which was proven my his blood work. But more importantly, he is eating better, has gained weight, is more playful and looks so much better (his hair prior was looking pretty bad). There have been big drug companies paying people to bad mouth this amazing product since they are threatened by its success and its effectiveness. The product was NOT pulled off the market by the FDA...the company agreed to change the name after being told its marketing was not in line with what FDA requires. FDA never had a problem with RenAvast/AminAvast's effectiveness or safety. Anyone stating this certainly has a hidden agenda. I will never take my cat off AminAvast and I thank my vet all the time for suggesting this product that has saved my baby's life. Thank you Bio Health Solutions and AminAvast!!!!

My cat was recently diagnosed with CRF. The bet told me aminavast (formerly renavast) was highly recommended to help manage symptoms with no side effects. My cat was doing fine, may I add, but I felt I should do whatever possible to help. I gave my cat aminavast 2x daily for only 3 days and she threw up 4 times that night. She threw up everything in her system. It was terrifying! I held off on it for a few months. Tried it again once every other day for about a week. Again, she had an episode where she made the sounds as though about to vomit but nothing came up. She acted lethargic, sad, and completely unnatural. After taking her off again, I see she wants to be around us more and seems happier. I told my vet about my experience. After doing research we found that renavast had been pulled from the market by the FDA. Now they market renavast as aminavast. My vet said they were pulling the brand from their shelves immediately. Maybe aminavast will help your animal. But if they start acting anything like my cat did, they need to be taken off of it immediately. Your experience may not be like everyone else's. I emailed renavast's customer service letting them know about our experience, but haven't received a response. I don't believe aminavast has no side effects and I will never attempt to administer it to my cat again!

I decided to give all my 8 rescue cats Renavast.  Two of my cats suffer from Stomatitis.  Renavast is not known to help with Stomatitis that I know of.  However, I have seen a huge improvement in less drooling, more energy, and appetite.

Our cat Max was diagnosed with end-stage kidney failure at the age of 13. RenAvast was unknown in our small town  at that time and the vet expected me to put him down, as most vets do. Looking down at the hopeful expression in those little eyes, I knew he wasn't ready to leave yet, and neither was I. Getting back home I ran to the computer to educate myself all I could on this disease (something everyone in a desperate situation should do). That's when I found the RenAvast website. I quickly ordered my first bottle, which arrived soon after. I followed the dosage according to his weight at that time, mixing it with his canned special diet.  In addition to the RenAvast, he received sub-Q treatments twice weekly and was placed on a prescription diet formulated for patients in renal failure. That was two years ago. Within 2 months after starting RenAvast, he started gaining weight and stamina, even climbing trees on occasion. I found it helpful to purchase some digital baby scales online so I could track his weight on my own rather than waiting for his next vet visit.  He loves to eat, so we have a regular battle of the bulge going on, but they feel better when their weight is under control. So don't be afraid to try this wonderful product. It's better to be safe than sorry. Guilt is a terrible thing to live with.

My cat is 18. She was lethargic around Christmas 2011. Previous cats of mine had experienced Chronic Renal Failure. I heard about Renavast and didn't believe there would be any harm in trying it. I ordered starting maybe in January 2012. It worked right away. I could tell she felt better. I don't remember whether I had the relevant lab tests done since adoption in 2005 when BUN and Creatinine were within proper range. Her test results in January 2013 were BUN 46 and Creatinine 2.3.  The results in March 2014 were BUN 45 and Creatinine 2.5. The vet says that this is all relatively good. I believe she is holding her own vis-a-vis CRF and I am glad of it. She's been taking Renavast for over 2-1/2 years and we are going to stick with it, for sure. She stays awake long hours, is attentive to whatever is going on, is calm, has a good appetite, drinks water occasionally, grooms herself, enjoys music, greets guests whenever they visit, cuddles, plays, and looks great.

In August 2012, my 9-year-old Nacho spent four days in the hospital after being diagnosed with kidney disease.  Upon his release, I had to give him sub-q injections daily.  We both hated it.  The vet tech at the animal sanctuary where I volunteer said she'd heard good things about RenAvast.  I was willing to try anything.  Within two weeks, Nacho's kidney function improved to the point where I could cut down his sub-q to every other day.  Two weeks later, we were able to reduce his sub-q to once a week.  Another two weeks....the vet took Nacho totally off the sub-q's and told me to keep doing what I was doing.  Nacho gets his blood tested every six months.  Two years later, at age 11, he's still off his sub-q and is going strong.  I still get his blood tested every six months, holding my breath until I get the results.  I am so very, very thankful to RenAvast and tell everyone I meet who has a kitty (and working at a dog and cat sanctuary, I meet a lot!).

I thank my vet each time I see her for saving my cats life by suggesting RenAvast. My cats creatinine and BUN have come down and he is eating better and WAY more active. Great product and super easy to give. Thanks Bio Health Solutions for a life saving product!

I put my cat on Renavast after her vet diagnosed her with kidney disease. I was pretty scared when my vet told me Wendy had already lost about 3/4 of her kidney function. And when I went home and read up on kidney disease and renal failure, I think I got even more scared. Wendy had been drinking a lot of water, wasn't as playful, and even lost a little weight. She was 17 years old and I thought I was losing her.  Well, guess what. That was 2 years ago! Wendy is eating great and looks great. I only occasionally give her fluids. And she still plays with my other cat. I am so grateful to have found the Renavast product.

My cat, Lil Joe, was diagnosed by my veterinarian with chronic kidney disease. My vet is an internist and very knowledgeable about the detrimental effects of this disorder. I was directed to give Joe RenAvast and was immediately skeptical. I joined a number of chat groups, and overall most had great things to say about their experience. Things like safety, side effects and in particular the research behind RenAvast were very important to me. I contacted the company, Bio Health Solutions, and they were very thorough and answered all of my questions. They weren't pushy or salesy  and expressed a sincere interest in Joe's well-being. They encouraged me to maintain regular contact with my vet, which I thought was admirable. To date, Joe appears to have more energy, has an increased appetite, has stopped vomiting and has gained weight. I'm very happy so far and look forward to more success as Joe continues this regimen.

I started my cat on Renavast 3 months ago and the improvement has been substantial. My cat has Chronic Renal Failure. Since starting on Renavast she is eating a lot more, moving about the house more, and her coat looks much healthier. Definitely would recommend this product to any cat and dog owners.

I drove for this company.  Spent a full 8 days on the road.  3 of the dogs had never been in a vehicle before and constantly threw up in their kennels.  Even though Tam was informed of this he kept expecting me to side track or stop and waite to pick up other dogs.  I refused because these dogs were not doing well after 5 days on the road already.  Ran up $2000 on my credit card because our contract promised reimbursement for rental vehicles, fuel, food, and hotels.  He hasn't paid me and now doesn't answere his phone.  I'm a disabled veteran who desperately  needed to earn money, and doing a job for him actually cost me $2000.  He's a piece of work,  dont utilize this service.

Simply the best. I never worry when Renny of Woof Wag Walk is taking care of my 2 active herding dogs. She loves like her own and makes sure that they not only get outside but they get the interaction and fun they need. You won't have to give their care another thought when you hire Woof Wag Walk.

I own a pet transportation company in San Diego, California.  I was invited to be a part of Petmasters by listing my business on their site.  A potential client reached out to me because they saw my business listed with Petmasters.  The job involved transporting a dog, three cats and a bird from Florida to Washington State.  We provided the client with a quote and the client booked with us.  This was a very big job and the client was very satisfied.  I would not have been able to execute this job if the client had not found my company but thanks to Petmasters... they found us. I highly recommend Petmasters to anyone.

Peter worked with our 1 year old German Shepherd who had severe anxiety and fear issues.  He helped her master all facets of obedience and that structure alleviated a lot of her stress.  She continues to be a high strung girl, it's the way she's wired, but by constantly reinforcing those basic principles of structure and obedience each day, we are able to help her slowly overcome her issues.

The pain of losing a pet is mind numbing, they are part of the family, it is life changing, and completely heart breaking. Deceased Pet Care is a amazing company that will help you through those final decisions. They have been there for us through 4 losses in the past 20 years. Each time treating us with care, compassion, and commitment to honor our lost love ones. They aren't out to make money off of you, you can trust them, they just want to help, and we will forever be grateful to them for helping us honor our lost love ones for the past 20 years.

I bought a Fluval Flex glass 57L from Sedgley Road Aquarium. The staff were very helpful with their advice as to how to set it up, how much substrate, what size heater. The shop also gave advice on getting the water conditioned and testing it prior to introducing any fish to ensure no fish losses. I told them I would be using rain water so should be okay. They advised caution. I bought some plants from them and they have both true aquatic plants and semi-aquatic plants for sale. The tanks these are held in were marked up with chinagraph pencil as to which type of plant is in them. I particularly liked the shops 'grading' of fish using coloured spots with regard to peaceable community fish to those not to be trusted with smaller fish. Over the course of several weeks the water became acceptable for fish and knowing the size of my tank, the staff advised me on the type of fish to buy and introduce first. They also advised me to carry on water testing in case of a Nitrite/Nitrate spike and not to add more fish for at least a fortnight. I bought 5 neon tetras and some more plants. Towards the end of the fortnight the Nitrite/Nitrate levels started to rise. I went into the shop and told them of the rise. They advised a partial water change and sold me some water conditioning 'bacteria' to help bring the levels down. I bought some more plants. Two weeks later the levels were fine and I added 3 Harlequins and some more plants. Two weeks after that I added a pair of Guppies and some more plants. I have had no fish losses and the staff have used their knowledge and advice to help me, have the patience to (slow me down in order to), create a lovely planted aquarium. I know that if I see something I'm not sure of all I need to do is ask.

TLDR: Many of the aquarium plants they sell are NOT aquarium plants and will die within a couple of months. They have a large range of live plants in underwater tanks upstairs in the shop. Being new to aquatic plants I opted to purchase from the local aquatic shop, who I assumed must know what they're doing. Purchased 8 plants (in pots with labels). The labels all helpfully show how much light, what temperature and best aquarium location for the plants. Later researched on the internet on how to care for them and found 6 of the plants are not true aquatic plants and would be dead within a month or two. Not only does this feel a little dishonest, it could have a disastrous impact on water chemistry and harm any fish when the plants eventually die and decompose. Feels a bit like a scam. Tanks with a mix of aquatic and NON aquatic plants and all underwater, even the ones that can't survive underwater for long. I'm sure a lot of beginners made the mistake I did. And the shop assistant didn't mention, "hey, you're buying some weird mix of aquatic and non-aquatic plants, do you know what you're doing?". I brought multiples of: Hemiographis colorata, Ophiopogon kyoto, Chlorophytum bichettii. All would die underwater. Stick to buying plants off the internet where you can do proper research before purchase.
I was not happy with the delay in getting my order, however, they sweetened the deal by offering extra discount. Will give them a try again in future.

I ordered about $270 worth of marine fish and the shippers must have left them on my porch when I came home they where no where to be found. Petsolutions replaced them with no hassle..... everything came in Alive and heathly I was a happy and repeat customer

I purchased the 25lb bag of Vita Parrot Food which my Conure parrot has been eating for 22 Years. I have NEVER had a bag contain bugs but this bag was INFESTED with little black antlike creatures!! I could not believe my eyes. Now that I'm reading reviews of old food, I have to agree the food/fruit & seed was really old & stale!. After pouring the entire bag into my air tight plastic storage container I noticed the bugs crawling on the walls. So disgusting & a complete waste of money. It was cheaper than the $75 I usually pay but I paid the price using this absolutely miserable company!! Don't ever order from them. I think they are out of business & it should STAY that way.

I ordered 5 packages of Nature's Variety Instinct Raw Boost Mixers (Rabbit).  #1 was my fault.  I didn't read the list of ingredients.  Thought I was buying freeze-dried bits of raw meat to add to their kibble, when in fact a very large portion of ingredients include seeds and vegetables.  #2 is why I'm writing this review.  When 5 bags arrived, one package looked different.   After confirming all products were in fact the same thing, I checked the Best By dates and it turned out the one odd package was newer packaging dated Oct 2019 while the other 4 were older and dated Apr 2018.  So they basically are good for a couple of months.  No way my cats can eat those 4 bags in 2 months. I will never purchase here again.  This was my first time since I normally order from Chewy.  PetSolutions offered a better price on these products but I won't make that mistake again.  Exercise caution!

I placed three orders from pet solutions. All three were for saltwater fish. The first order was for a yellow breasted wrasse, it was dead on arrival.  The second order was for a Choate leopard dress, and ornate leopard wrasse  and a replacement for the dead yellow breasted wrasse.  On the day the order was supposed to ship I received an email that the order was canceled. I called to find out why and was told the Choat Wrasse was still available  but the other two weren't. When I asked why they didn't just ship the Choate grass I really didn't get an answer. I was told my $300  would be refunded in a day or two since it was a pending transaction. As of today it has been six days and still no credit. During that conversation I asked if the Choate wrasse was still available and was told it was.  like a fool I ordered two so I would be sure to get at least one I thought. I called to verify several times as a matter fact, I called the morning it was to ship. I was  told they would ship today. A little while ago they canceled my order again! Once again  I called to inquire as to why my order was canceled again and was told the Choate wrasse were out of stock. I really believe since I was standing up for myself the previous order that my Choate  wrasse were shipped to someone else over me. When I was speaking to customer service a little while ago the girl told me she didn't understand why they kept doing this to me. I now  have $600 tied up with pet solutions and nothing to show for it. I am beyond upset and if I don't have my money in the next day or two I'm filing a complaint .  I just checked the website and the choked grass is still showing available! What a bunch of idiots.

The person I was advised to speak to well over a MONTH ago STILL has not spoken to me.  This is in regards to a 10 month old puppy that was sick when I got her.  It seems everyone shifts the blame because no one wants to be held accountable.  Very poor customer service!!!!.  I have spent well over $6,000.00 on vet bills and the owner refuses to acknowledge any wrong doing.  I have documentation by three vets that she was ill at birth yet sold knowing this....despicable  !!!!!

Our company ordered 8 boxes of the petite dental chews and to our surprise, the chews were not individually packaged as implied on their website. Before ordering, I also asked one of their customer representatives confirming these would come in individual packages. When I called their customer support, the girl I spoke to said that not all of them are individually packaged. However, that important piece of information is nowhere on the website so how was I supposed to know?She could not offer any solution except that they will take pay for the return shipping label. Which is really a pathetic resolution on their part. I then spoke with their manager and suggested that they ship us the individually packaged Greenies at the same cost as the ones we ordered as a one time courtesy for this inconvenience but was told no. Because of their misleading advertisement, we now have to purchase a whole batch of individual bags to put the treats in. We ordered these treats for 15 of our hotels and planned to re-order from them. But due to their inability to rectify the problem caused by their miscommunication, we will be looking for a different vendor for our next batch order.

My puppy utilized the over night services offered. We both were very pleased with the level of care provided. Groomers were friendly and knowledgeable. I feel I've found a a home away from home for my puppy, King :)

I ordered 20 neon tetra and 6 angelfish from them. Delivery was 2 days. In the neon tetra bag, 4 fish were already dead and the others were pale. In the angelfish bag, 2 of them were already dead, the water was a "mirky" white and the other 4 angels were covered in ich. I quarantined the remaining 4 angels only to have them die off over the next two days. The remaining neons were also quarantined as they also had ich on them. These guys all died off over the next 3 days. None of the fish ever recovered from the ich even with the treatments I was giving them. Petsolutions eventually did refund my money, but to sell someone such poor quality and unhealthy fish is very very poor business, not to mention bad for the fish. I will not purchase livestock from these folks again.
